content.description: The left (south) aspect of the South Buttress has a pretty loose base of scree. Wade about 30 feet up the left side of the buttress on the loose scree to reach a niche. Climb up and right (toward the road) out of the niche along a flake (small cams) to a stance. Climb up the arête above past two bolts to a communal anchor. Rappel with one rope.
content.protection: Two bolts and a couple small cams protect this route.
content.location: This route is located on the South Buttress (the crag located closest to Bridgeport). The left (south) aspect of the South Buttress has a pretty loose base of scree. Wade about 30 feet up the left side of the buttress on the loose scree to reach a niche.

content.description: Rope up about 20 feet right of Luke Skywalker at a left facing flake system. Climb up along the flake system to an anchor (the anchor can be accessed from the communal anchor for Walker Texas Ranger and Luke Skywalker).
content.location: Rope up about 20 feet right of Luke Skywalker at a left facing flake system. This flake system is behing the prominent pine trees in the left center of the crag.

content.description: In the right center of the buttress is a clean face with two short vertical cracks. The area between the cracks is fairly blank and has a single, old, ¼ bolt with a faded sling and rappel ring attached to it. Its unknown if this route was ever completed.
content.protection: One bolt, thin wires and TCUs should protect the route.
content.location: In the right center of the South Buttress is a clean face with two short vertical cracks. This face is to the right of a prominent left facing corner. This route may connect those two vertical cracks.

content.description: Start at the lower left corner of the buttress at a low ceiling. Climb past the low ceiling (bolt) into a vertical finger crack, which leads to a stance on the arête. Climb up the arête above past two bolts to a communal anchor. Rappel with one rope.
content.protection: Three bolts and a few TCUs protect this route.
content.location: Start at the lower left corner of the South Buttress at a low ceiling.

content.description: This route is located on a separate formation that is about 15 feet to the right of the main South Buttress. Climb the left center of the small formation to the summit. You may or may not find this climb to be dy-na-mite!
content.location: This route is located on a separate formation that is about 15 feet to the right of the main South Buttress.
